active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the optimal idle and absolute timeout durations for a banking app versus a casual social media site. Consider trade-offs between user experience, data sensitivity, and OWASP recommendations. Support arguments with real-world examples of session hijacking incidents.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in 'Insufficient Session Expiration' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Security Architecture Vulnerabilities > Application Architecture Vulnerabilities > Web Application Architecture Flaws > Insufficient Session Expiration). Use university pedagogy: Bloom's Taxonomy (mix remember/understand/apply/analyze/evaluate/create), active learning (inspired by provided discussion/peer teaching/problem-solving), and scaffolding (Layer 1: Foundation terms like session/idle/absolute timeout; Layer 2: OWASP WSTG-SESS-07/server-side enforcement; Layer 3: Code implementation; Layer 4: Integration with hijacking/compliance). Learning Objectives: [Insert full list above]. Active Learning Ideas: [Insert summaries]. Scaffolding: [Insert layers]. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards (10 per Bloom's level where possible). Cover research context: risks of extended sessions, session re-use, server-side necessity, OWASP guidance. Output JSON array: [{'id':1, 'bloom_level':'Remember', 'scaffolding_layer':1, 'front':'Question text', 'back':{'answer':'Correct answer', 'explanation':'Rationale with sources/implications', 'distractors':['A','B','C'] (if MCQ)}}]. Vary formats: 40% MCQ (3 distractors per protocol), 20% true/false, 20% short answer, 20% code/scenario. Ensure active recall, no hints on front. Distractors plausible/misconception-based.
